meanings.definition: To impress or influence by power, authority, or force
meanings.sent1: The strong leader overawes the crowd with his speeches.
meanings.sent2: The teacher overawes her students with her knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The magician overawes the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The storm overawes the small town with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The superhero overawes the villains with his incredible strength.

meanings.definition: To subdue or restrain by awe
meanings.sent1: The majestic mountain overawes climbers with its height.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of the sunset overawes the couple on their date.
meanings.sent3: The adorable puppy overawes the family with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The silence of the library overawes visitors with its peacefulness.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the night overawes children with its mystery.
